content: there's no values in the tables that are zero.  i think this is an issue, if a testcase actually had a zero, some solutions would fail.  NULL/empty values should be detected properly. Your solution uses None, which would work.  Others might not.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A fine puzzle! I spent more time in coding a proper input parsing and output formatting then in coding the deduction... :-)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Reading and writing the table is what makes this one interesting to me. Good job!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: looks good to me!

Goal
* Please add the following paragraph just below the example table:

The character {{|}} is used to separate table cells in the same row, and the character {{_}} is used to draw horizontal separators between rows.

* Please replace "Each number is written from left to right and has added spaces if needed." with:

Each number is left-aligned and padded with spaces on the right, if necessary.

* Just curious: why not right-align all the numbers?

Input / Cases
* Please remove Line 1 (rowNum). Players can deduce the number of data rows themselves. Removing this also aligns better with the absence of column count in the input.

* Line 1 (originally Line 2): Please add the description:

the total number of lines of the table

* Next [[inputLines]] lines: Please change "_'s" to "horizontal separators".

Output
* Please mention that trailing spaces in each line should not be removed.

Constraints
* First constraint: It should be removed after the [[rowNum]] input is removed per above.

* Second constraint: Please change the lower bound to 2.

Stub generator
* The write statement is missing.

Cases
* Subtraction (test): There's an extra space in the cell containing -6 in the last line of the input.

* Subtraction.1 (validator): The input line starting with 7 is missing a trailing space.

* Small (test): Please change the operator from "+" to "-" and update the output accordingly.

* Please add a new pair of cases with all the following properties:
  • The operator is "+".
  • Number of columns > number of rows.
  • At least one row header, at least one column header and at least one inner cell contain negative integers.

Cover picture
* Consider uploading a cover picture for the puzzle.

Thanks.

* Just curious: why not right-align all the numbers?
- Because I think it just looks more natural for them to be aligned to the left rather to the right.

Oh..... forgot about that number.....

Will update. Thanks

Constraints
* Please change the lower bound to 2.

Cases
* In "BIG" (test), the input lines are not of equal length, and the "|"s are misaligned.

* Also, I mistakenly used the wrong inequality sign in my earlier comment. What I meant was: number of columns < number of rows, not the reverse. My bad. Apologies for that.

Could you please fix this by either transposing / modifying the tables in "BIG" (test) and "BIG.1" (validator), or by creating a new pair of cases?

Thanks.

Cases
* "BIG" (test): Please fix the first input line, as the "|"s are still misaligned.

* "BIG" (test): All horizontal separators in the input is one character short.

* "CG" (test): Please delete the extra space in the cell containing -8 in the input.

Thanks.

Constraints
* Please add:
Every number in the completed table is an integer between -10⁵ and 10⁵.

Cases
* BIG (Test 5): Please delete the trailing newline from the input.

Thanks.
